articles.title: Trump attempts to pin some blame for missile attacks on Obama, outraging Democrats
articles.description: Trump used his first public remarks more than 12 hours after the Iranian attacks on U.S. bases to bash his predecessor with a misleading and incomplete narrative of the Iran nuclear deal.
articles.content:
The missiles fired last night at us and our allies were paid for with the funds made available by the last administration, Trump said in a claim deemed both misleading and far-fetched by The Washington Posts Fact Checker.
That Trump would criticize Obama for… [+7072 chars]

articles.title: A timeline of the escalation in the Middle East
articles.description: In May 2018, the United States withdrew from the Iran nuclear deal. Throughout 2019, economic sanctions were imposed as part of President Trump’s “maximum pressure campaign,” further escalating tensions in the region.

articles.title: Don’t allow McConnell to swear a false oath
articles.description: A nation governed by the rule of law cannot let a senator flout it.
articles.content: To swear a false oath is perjury the crime President Bill Clinton was charged with in his impeachment. Yet given the Constitutions speech or debate clause, a senator likely could not be charged with perjury for swearing falsely on the Senate floor. Instead, i… [+4174 chars]

articles.title: U.S. and Iran step back, but underlying tensions remain acute
articles.description: President Trump announced punishing new sanctions, while Khamenei said compromise would not appease the United States.
articles.content:

articles.title: Iraqi leaders plead for calm after Iranian missile strikes on U.S. military
articles.description: Officials and clerics, caught in the middle, urged de-escalation after missiles hit two bases that house U.S. troops.

articles.title: Iran took revenge, no one died, and the risk of war abates, for now
articles.description: Iran’s ballistic missile attack on U.S. forces appeared to be calculated to avert a bigger escalation. But the risk of further confrontation remains.
articles.content:
After a few tense hours during which the Middle East seemed to move to the verge of a new war, it appeared Wednesday that a significant confrontation between the United States and Iran had been contained, at least for now.
